static.name: patch
text: returns the latest changes to a hero in dota from the latest balance patch.
using ``patch <hero>`` alone will return the changes from the latest patch,
while using ``patch <version> <hero>`` will return the changes from that spec
ific patch (currently only down to version 6.79).

static.name: talents
text: returns the current talents of a requested hero.

static.name: ability
text: returns info about a hero's ability.
there are multiple aliases for abilites, you can discover them all
simply by using commands! supplying a hero is not required.

static.name: wiki
text: returns the dota 2 wiki link for a specified hero.

static.name: list
text: returns a list of all the patches in the database that a hero recieved changes in.

dynamic.name: register
dynamic.usage: register <steam profile, dotabuff link or opendota link>
text: register your steam profile with the bot.
accepts a steam profile link or a dotabuff/opendota link.
the bot account will send you a friend request on steam
along with a direct message on discord with instructions.

dynamic.name: playerinfo
text: returns some basic player info for a specified person.
accepts a dotabuff or opendota link, as well as a username mention (if that user
has their profile linked.)

dynamic.name: matchinfo
text: returns information about a specific dota match.

dynamic.name: lastmatch
text: looks up your last match (if you are registered) and returns it.
also can be used to look up other user's matches.

meta.name: info
text: returns some info about the bot.

meta.name: invite
text: invite link for the bot

meta.name: botstats
text: returns some stats about the bot

meta.name: help
text: return list of help topics, or specific help about a topic.

admin.name: admin
text: displays the current config for the server.

admin.name: admin prefix
text: change the server specific prefix (note: will still respond to `--`)

admin.name: admin cooldowns
admin.usage: admin cooldowns <channel or member> <time in seconds>
text: sets the cooldowns for the entire guild for members or channels.
for example: if the channel cooldown is 10,
10 seconds must pass before a new command is processed. all commands in between the time of the first command and

any new commands are ignored. 

recommended cooldowns: 10 seconds for member and 5 seconds for channel. 
default cooldowns: 0.

admin.name: admin disable
text: disables a list of commands per channel.
note: you can not disable commands from the meta or admin categories.
use the admin command by itself to see disabled commands for a channel.

admin.name: admin enable
text: re enables a list of commands for a channel.
use the admin command by itself to see a list of disabled commands.
